Speaker: bond
Dialogue: There has to be an easier way to earn a living.

Speaker: bond's voice
Dialogue: Seven, in position.

Speaker: tanner's voice
Dialogue: Roger, Seven.

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: - I'll be sure to acknowledge 007's 'assistance' in my report to the Prime Minister. But this is, still, a naval operation.

Speaker: general bukharin
Dialogue: 'In a joint operation, someone's nose always gets put out of joint.'

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: A regular terrorist swap meet. Death at discount: Two Chinese Long March Scuds, a pair of Soviet A-17 attack helicopters -

Speaker: bukharin
Dialogue: Stolen -

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: And the crates look like American M-16 assault rifles, Chilean antipersonnel mines, six French Exocet missiles, and 75 - no maybe a hundred - kilograms of Czech made C-4 Semtech explosive.  Something for everyone. Fun for the whole family.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: One to seven: Deal the face cards.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Gustav Meinholtz. Neo-Nazi, former East German STASI agent. Ties to the Beider-Meinhoff gang.  Aces high, seven. Bid to the east.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Vilko Barkoviac. Bosnian war criminal; thought to be operating freelance out of Teheran.  Full house, seven. Bid to the North.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Sitoshi Isagura. Japanese religious fanatic. Wanted for the Tokyo subway -

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: Tell your man to drop back. We're initiating plan B -

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: - Thank you, M. But this is more than your man can handle.  Are we in agreement?

Speaker: bukharin
Dialogue: - Yes. Yes.

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: Command to Nelson: Authorization to fire.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Weapons authorized. Prepare to fire. On my count: Five. Four. Three. Two -

Speaker: firing officer
Dialogue: Cruise missile away -

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: I appreciate your assistance, M. But this is now a military operation.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: One to seven: Exit target area. Repeat -

Speaker: bond's voice
Dialogue: Seven to one. Negative. Wait.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Oh, no.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Kim Dae Yung. North Korean Nuclear specialist.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: I don't know. He's not in the database -

Speaker: bukharin
Dialogue: ... We usually... Transport... Weapons grade uranium.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Maybe. Maybe not.

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: It's too late -

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: One to seven - one to seven -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Negative, one. NOT YET.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Soviet SB-9 nuclear torpedo. Yield, one kiloton.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: Jesus. Can't you people keep anything locked up?

Speaker: general bukharin
Dialogue: We didn't know it was missing.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: God help him.

Speaker: bond's voice
Dialogue: Seven to base. I have a full house. Your bid.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: By the way: Thank the General for all his "assistance." Over and out.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... And what do you call these?

Speaker: jenny wu
Dialogue: Ja-shwa tsway. These are lips.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Indeed they are.  Deadly little things.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And what do you call these? The Gang of Two?

Speaker: jenny wu
Dialogue: Stop it!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I was just getting to the interesting part!

Speaker: jenny wu
Dialogue: We've already done the interesting part. Do you forget?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Remind me.

Speaker: jenny wu
Dialogue: Sakwa!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Is that Mandarin, or Cantonese?

Speaker: jenny wu
Dialogue: Mandarin. You jerk.  I'm late. I have to get dressed.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Hello, James. I hope I'm interrupting something important.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Not at all, Moneypenny. I was just brushing up on a little Chinese.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: I'm sure she is, James. But I'm afraid you'll have to 'kiss off' the rest of your lessons this afternoon.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Moneypenny... Here I was, finally getting a feel for a new tongue -

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Four o'clock. M will meet you in the conference room.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: 4:30. It may take me a little longer to wrap things up here.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Four o'clock. Don't be late.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Tsi tien, Chien-penny.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Ah, James. You always were a cunning linguist... Au revoir, mon cher.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Don't ask.

Speaker: student
Dialogue: Good afternoon, Professor Wu.

Speaker: jenny wu
Dialogue: Good afternoon.  Are you sure you can't stay for the lecture?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I can't. But I did enjoy the dress rehearsal.

Speaker: jenny wu
Dialogue: Tsi tien, Mr. Bond.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Tsi tien, Professor Wu.

Speaker: hnn anchor
Dialogue: You're watching HNN, the Harmsway 24 hour news network. Coming up:  A special report on the situation in Hong Kong, since the Chinese take- over from Great Britain.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Nothing like a little imperialism to promote loyalty among the faithful.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes, M.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Interesting presentation.

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: Interesting video tape.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: They point, I shoot.

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: Do you have a pen? I just got promoted and don't have my new cards yet.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: ... Does this do anything?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Depends what number you write.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Married?

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: Happily.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Kids?

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: Three. You? Married?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: I didn't think so.

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: Here. I gave you my assistant's phone number. If it's urgent, she knows where to reach me.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Thanks.  Take care -

Speaker: dominique
Dialogue: You too.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Moneypenny! We've got to stop meeting like this. They may be on to us.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Hello, James. Enjoy your meeting?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: In the darkest moments, it's what I live for. Especially since I've heard how much you like to watch... On the hidden camera.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: By the way, James: Ordinarily I would never ask, but... Weren't you and that Colonel once stranded on a raft for two weeks in the Sargasso Sea?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Moneypenny! How indiscreet! Have you ever known me to kiss and tell?

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Actually, I've never known you to do either... But -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: - We all want what we can't have?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What - no lust for adventure?

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: No, 007. It's just that I've learned from personal experience - that when we get what we want -  Somehow the reality is never as... Satisfying as the fantasy.

Speaker: moneypenny
Dialogue: Don't keep M waiting.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Of course.  Minister Johnstone.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Only what I read in the newspapers.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: His newspapers?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: British media mogul. Born in Hong Kong; controls newspapers, TV, radio, cable, satellites; books, magazines, movies, computer software. Theme parks.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: 'Able to topple governments with a single story' - as he says in his press.

Speaker: johnstone
Dialogue: Exactly.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... What's Harmsway done?

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: A rumor - from an anonymous source -

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: Hearsay. Idle chatter from a source you can't identify - who insists on talking only to 007. Nothing but loose talk and innuendo.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: More scurrilous, unsubstantiated gossip.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Perhaps. But it does explain how an ex-KGB agent turned illegal-arms dealer is suddenly portrayed as a long-time friend of the people.  If you believe what you read in the papers.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: Need I remind the two of you that Elliot Harmsway - Sir Elliot Harmsway - is directly descended from the Earl of Aberdeen? That his Scottish ancestors practically invented Hong Kong - and out of sheer gratitude, Queen Victoria herself named the port "Aberdeen Harbor" in their honor?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Didn't we once investigate Harmsway?

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: Not to mention the chaos it caused at Whitehall when his newspapers began screaming for the recall of the sitting government.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How will I meet the informant?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: There is one last thing, 007: Elliot Harmsway is vital to the economic interests of this nation. He's also a major contributor to the party. I expect him to be given every consideration.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Political considerations?

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: To the best of my recollection, Mr. Bond, I suggested no such thing.  In fact, I was never here.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: .... I hate to ask, but... Did you ever think you'd miss Communism?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Hopefully, it won't get that far.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Okay, Saunders. What is it this time? Rocket in the leg? Machine pistol in the arm?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Q's retirement party. I'd just put the knife into the cake, and -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Come on. I know better than that -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It must do something.

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Well... If you insist.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The die is cast.

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Now pay attention, 007. We haven't much time to demonstrate your new Q toys.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How is old Q?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Gone fishing.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Fishing?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Big game fishing.  Sonar torpedoes. Retirement gift from his friends at the CIA.

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: In the meantime, perhaps this will spark your interest.  Cigarette lighter. Thumb here, press here -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Saunders, I've lit cigarettes -

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Not from forty feet.

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: The disposable lighter also contains a small self-detonation charge  Depending on who - or what - you wish to dispose of.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Shoelaces?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Plastique explosive shoelaces.  Cut them to regulate the size of the blast; totally harmless until you attach the detonator hidden in the heel of your shoe.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Perfect way to tie up a... 'Knotty' problem?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: And a code breaking microprocessor here. Swipe it through any card reader - anywhere - you're in.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Does it work on cash machines?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: It was an authorized test. I returned the money.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I see...

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Finally, your new watch: Blue laser here for signaling or burning through locks; press this button, the sweep hand becomes a Geiger counter.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: If you can't do the time, don't do the crime?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: Oh. I almost forgot. There is one last thing: Before Q retired, he asked that I give you one other protective device.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: A wedding band??? What am I supposed to be able to do with this?

Speaker: saunders
Dialogue: I believe Q's exact words were:  "Hopefully, nothing."

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...I'll give you a ring from Venice.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Till death do us part.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Buona sera, signore -

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Vino?

Speaker: masked woman
Dialogue: I may have been followed. Meet me at the Church in five minutes!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Looking for someone?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Hello, James.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Paris?!? What are you doing here?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Is that any way to say hello?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I thought your specialty was good-bye.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Oh, James. I've missed you -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Is this another one of your games?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Stop it! You're hurting me! Can't you just be nice?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I've got half the British government breathing down my neck. I don't have time for your nonsense.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Don't you even miss me? Didn't I mean anything to you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What about Elliot Harmsway? Or is this just another one of your stunts?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: You've got to help me, James. I'm sorry. I'm sorry for everything. I know I was wrong - but you've got to protect me. I know you still love -

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Do you feel better now?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Do you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What about the uranium?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: It's on the boat. He's holding a press conference tomorrow.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: I'm so sorry, James. I promise, I'll never leave you again.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Shhhhh...

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Just hold me.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How do you know Harmsway?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Kiss me.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Bastard! Leave me alone!

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Who is he?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Nobody. Just some drunk. Leave him alone -

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Take her to the boat.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: So that's how he does it.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Prego, prego. Permissio.

Speaker: tourist
Dialogue: Grazie.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Grazie -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He fought hard...  But the case was terminal.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You've confirmed all the legal details with M?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Let's go over this one more time.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And you'll wait until after the press conference - and everyone is gone - before you board the boat and arrest him.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...And so, it's somewhat fitting that we are here today... To christen this environmental research boat in Venice - - 'Venezia' - the port where Marco Polo sailed forth to explore the world's great uncharted oceans...  That 2/3 of the earth's surface where the sharks are not working members of the press.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: With our six custom designed sea-bed coring drills, we will probe the long-term effects of pollution; our sonars, radars, and research labs will study the wind, the water, and the sea life that so dearly feeds us.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: And so, in the spirit of international cooperation - thanking my good friend, Valentin Zukofsky - the newly elected President of the Ukraine for all his assistance -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I give this boat to mankind - selflessly - in pure charity asking nothing for myself... But the cable TV rights.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Miss Venice? If you'll do the honors -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Now I'll take some questions from the press - even the few of you who aren't on my payroll.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Actually, my first choice was 'No Comment.' So if someone asked where I was, I could truthfully respond 'No Comment.'  Over there.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: No comment.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Level one, secure.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: The maiden voyage begins tonight. I have some business in London - but the ship will sail down the Nile, across the South China Sea, stopping in Australia, winding up in San Francisco.

Speaker: valentin's voice
Dialogue: Mr. James Bond!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Valentin. What an unpleasant surprise.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: What is it that brings you to Venezia, Mr. Bond? Business -  Or somebody else's business?

Speaker: sofia
Dialogue: Dimitri!!! You promised I could go shopping!!

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: So? Go!

Speaker: sofia
Dialogue: I need money.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Here. Take an inch.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Come. Let me buy you a drink. It's free.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: And you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: One.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I must say, Valentin, capitalism seems to be treating you well.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Off the record.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Of course. If you can't beat the government, you might as well own it.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Wait - I want you to meet a friend of mine.  Elliot! Elliot! Come here.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: Elliot Harmsway, I want to introduce you to an old friend -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The name is Bond. James Bond.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Always nice to meet one of her Majesty's fellow subjects...  Especially one with such distinguished friends.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You might say I've always been one of Mr. Valentin's biggest followers.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: 'Biggest followers?' He's practically made a career' of it!!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It's a beautiful boat, Sir Elliot. Practically glows in the dark.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I want you to meet my wife.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Paris Harmsway, allow me to introduce you to James Bond.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: But then... I believe you two have already met.

Speaker: valentin
Dialogue: I think I suddenly remembered an urgent meeting in Moscow.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: My friends, there's been a terrible mistake.  Come. Let me show you.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Paris -

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Leave me alone! He's going to kill me!!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me? Why wasn't it in our files?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: You've got to protect me!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Go to my hotel room. I'll be there in twenty minutes.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Just - say it. Say it just once.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: One thing at a time. I'll see you in twenty minutes. Go.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I believe this is what you're looking for, Colonel.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Is it uranium? Absolutely. But watch -  It's depleted uranium! Completely safe! A child could sleep on it.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I received it from the Russian government - a by-product of their nuclear arms program - in the hopes that I could create tools for oceanographic research.  It's what I was talking about: 'Swords into plowshares'! The Sprit of International Cooperation!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Please. No harm done, Don Franco. Go upstairs, and enjoy the reception.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Oh - Mr. Bond. One minute.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I hope you've enjoyed this little charade.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Which part? The Colonel's? Or yours?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: It's deadlier than uranium.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We'll see about that.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Aren't you late for a meeting?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The Danielli. Presto!

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: That was too close.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Don't worry. Mr. Bond will get the message. So will his boss.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I'm going to the plane. Tell the captain to set sail at once.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Paris? Paris?

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: We've cleared Hong Kong harbor, sir.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Position?

Speaker: gps officer
Dialogue: Two-two, zed-three, one-five north; a hundred fourteen degrees, five minutes, ten seconds east.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Mark.

Speaker: gps officer
Dialogue: Locked on satellite, sir.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Set course, two-ten degrees, south south east.

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: Coming about, sir.

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Orders from London: For the next ninety-six hours, we're to run on full radio silence. Double watches, full alert.  We're to send one encrypted positioning burst to London every six hours - otherwise, zero electronic emissions.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Yes, sir!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: I'll be in my cabin until oh-six- hundred hours.

Speaker: second officer
Dialogue: Captain leaving the bridge.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Attention all hands. Now hear this...

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: Check the engine baffles; rig the generators for shielded operation.

Speaker: communications officer
Dialogue: Communications set to receive only, sir.

Speaker: rating
Dialogue: Radar switched to passive mode; sonar re-set to low-power operation.  You couldn't find our signature with a magnifying glass.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Let's hope so.

Speaker: second officer
Dialogue: Looks like we're in for a long, uncomfortable trip.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: We'll all breathe a lot easier when we get this cargo back to London.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Good morning, Gentlemen. I'm sorry to bring you here under these circumstances, but  Considering our meeting was already scheduled, this was a happy coincidence.

Speaker: number one
Dialogue: Sir Elliot: The entertainment division is releasing three new animated children's movies this year.  We anticipate revenues of 3.1 billion dollars.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Excellent, Number One. Build a better rat-trap, and the world truly will beat a path to your theme park.  Number Two?

Speaker: number two
Dialogue: As you're aware, Sir Elliot, our software division has introduced a new computer operating system, Gates '99.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Outstanding, Number Two.  Who's ahead in the American elections?

Speaker: number five
Dialogue: The Democrat, sir. By nine points.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Maybe it's time to publish that story about his sex life. Even things up. A close race is always better for our TV ratings.

Speaker: number five
Dialogue: Consider him slimed, sir.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Splendid. Next...  Number Three. Your report?

Speaker: number three
Dialogue: I regret to inform you, sir, that Saddam Hussein is still demanding a bonus for his role in the Gulf War.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...Haven't we already paid him for his services?

Speaker: number three
Dialogue: Yes, sir. But he still feels his people should share in the increased profits of our news division. He has proposed an additional 500 million dollar payment.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ... And there's no truth that 10% of that money will go into your Swiss bank account?

Speaker: number three
Dialogue: No sir! I swear! This is not true!!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: You disappoint me, Number Three.

Speaker: number three
Dialogue: Please sir. Please -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...But because I am a just man, I've decided to give Mr. Hussein what he deserves.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Mr. Stamper will escort you to the plane.

Speaker: number three
Dialogue: Thank you sir! Thank you!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Good-bye, Mr. Azziz.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Let's proceed with new business.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Gentlemen: In exactly 36 hours, we are going to initiate phase one of the word's most perfect crime: The biggest theft in the history of mankind.  Right here. In the Strait of Malacca.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Gum?

Speaker: number three
Dialogue: Thank you! Thank you so much. You must thank Sir Elliot for me.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Here. Something to read on the plane.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Bye-bye.

Speaker: navigation officer
Dialogue: ... This doesn't make sense. What's our heading now?

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: Zero one three. Due north.

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: We're on course again.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Can't see a damn thing in this fog.  Rating: What have we got?

Speaker: rating
Dialogue: A passenger ferry and two freighters broadcasting on low-band -

Speaker: communications
Dialogue: And two small fishing boats about 30k north. No radar, but we've identified their engine signatures.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: About every ninety seconds, the auto- pilot jogs us to the west.

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: Then re-sets us to the north.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Not in the Strait.  How's our position?

Speaker: navigating officer
Dialogue: According to the satellite, we're exactly on course.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Did you check the auto-pilot?

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: The back-up does the same thing.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Check it again. What about the global positioning satellite? Could there be something wrong with the signal?

Speaker: gps officer
Dialogue: Two words: Im-possible.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: How is it now?

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: Seems to be back to normal, sir.

Speaker: sonar operator
Dialogue: I have something off the port bow!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: A dead head.  Muncy! Engines to half!

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: Aye-aye sir. Engines to half.

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Chew up a log like that in the propeller, you end up with enough paperwork to go from here to London. Twice.

Speaker: communications officer
Dialogue: I'm getting an electrical emission, sir! Extremely close. Bearing 240 -

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Punch up the radar -

Speaker: radar operator
Dialogue: I've got it, sir. A large craft - XX,OOO tons. Range -  200 yards? It's anchored in a cove!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: That's impossible! We're in the middle of the channel!

Speaker: junior officer
Dialogue: Breakers off the port bow! We're heading for shore!

Speaker: sonar officer
Dialogue: Sir -

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Full stop!!! Call the captain!

Speaker: sonar officer
Dialogue: Sir!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: What?!?!

Speaker: sonar operator
Dialogue: The log is moving!

Speaker: senior operator
Dialogue: We've been hit! We're taking water!

Speaker: damage control
Dialogue: Flooding in the engine room!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Get me damage reports! Start the pumps!

Speaker: the captain
Dialogue: What the hell is going on?!?

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: I think we've been holed, sir!

Speaker: the captain
Dialogue: On my way!

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: The engines are gone!

Speaker: damage control
Dialogue: Flooding on D deck!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Sound the general alarm! Seal all compartments!

Speaker: systems officer
Dialogue: We've lost power!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Go to back up generators!

Speaker: damage control
Dialogue: Flooding on C-Deck!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Where the hell are those generators?

Speaker: systems engineer
Dialogue: Coming up, sir!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Get those pumps working!

Speaker: systems control
Dialogue: The back-up is gone!

Speaker: damage officer
Dialogue: Flooding up to B-Deck!

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: We can't hold out much longer, sir!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Where the hell is the Captain?!?!

Speaker: helmsman
Dialogue: Slipping to stern!

Speaker: damage officer
Dialogue: All major compartments flooded!

Speaker: first officer
Dialogue: Abandon ship! Break radio silence! Send our position!

Speaker: communications officer
Dialogue: What's our position?

Speaker: gps officer
Dialogue: One hundred degrees, thirty-one minutes, and seven seconds East, by two degrees, twenty-nine minutes, ten seconds, North.

Speaker: sonar operator
Dialogue: Six. That's it? Only six of us?

Speaker: cook
Dialogue: Most of the crew never made it to their life jackets. The Captain?

Speaker: sonar officer
Dialogue: The First officer stayed on the bridge.

Speaker: crewman
Dialogue: Hey - look! Over there!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Lovely night for a shipwreck, isn't it?

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: We've decoded their last transmission.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Perfect. They'll be searching miles from here.  Time for phase two. You can get the men in the water.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: You heard him. Get the men in the water!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: I can't believe it took us so long to finally get together! What exactly do you do for the government?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You might say... 'Public relations.'

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: How fascinating! I bet you meet all the most fabulous people.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Moneypenny! You're early. You weren't supposed to call until -  Yes. I understand. Twenty minutes.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: Good evening. I've just spoken with the Prime Minister at the economic summit in Tokyo; he's expecting a full update within the hour.  For those of you still unaware, some forty minutes ago -

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: This is an internal affair that should be handled strictly by the officers of her Majesty's Royal Navy.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: Admiral, are you suggesting -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late -

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: Yes. Of course.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I've looked forward to meeting you.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: As I was saying: Approximately forty- five minutes ago, we received an abandon ship signal from the H.M.S. Indomitable.  Looking at these infrared satellite images - provided by Mr. Tanner of MI-6 -the ship is presumed lost here, just south of Kuala Lumpur, where she broadcast her last position.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Divers approaching the hull.

Speaker: diver
Dialogue: It's titanium. we can't cut through.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: I'll do it.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Gentlemen: I do believe we've struck gold... Four minutes ahead of schedule.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: What is it? The equivalent of ten billion US dollars???

Speaker: treasury official
Dialogue: Give or take. Depending on today's currency rates -

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: What the hell was the gold doing on that boat?

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: We were bringing it back from Hong Kong. Under orders from the Treasury.

Speaker: treasury official
Dialogue: During the cold war, we stored a third in America, and another third in Hong Kong - in case of a nuclear attack. And with the turn-over of Hong Kong to the Chinese -

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: Why wasn't the ship protected?!?! Why was it sailing without radar?

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: I resent your tone, sir. I have men who are missing -

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: And I have the entire British economy to worry about.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Obviously, MI-6 was not involved in this operation. But I have to defend the Admiral.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: At least we know where the gold is. When are the recovery ships due?

Speaker: admiral roebuck
Dialogue: 36 hours. They've already sailed from the Persian gulf.

Speaker: minister johnstone
Dialogue: I expect to have that gold recovered in 36 hours. Until then, I'm imposing my own electronic silence: For the sake of the economy, not a word to NATO, the press, the CIA.  ...And so long as Commander Bond here seems to be such an expert on these matters, I want him to go along as an observer. Are we agreed?

Speaker: roebuck
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Remember the golden rule, Mr. Stamper: He who has the gold, rules.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Is the helicopter ready?

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Fueled and waiting.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Good. We have an appointment in Hong Kong.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I have an excellent teacher.  'Make sure you wear the uniform'?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It doesn't quite add up.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The infrared satellite images. No heat, no flame, no explosion. If that boat went down where they said it did, there should have been some residual heat reading on the surface.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: A three-thousand ton frigate doesn't just vanish into thin air.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Didn't Elliot Harmsway just move his headquarters to Kuala Lumpur?

Speaker: general li
Dialogue: And that is the fifth document. With your counter-signature, the sale will be complete.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: General Li: My young associate here has just informed me that if I waited a year, I could perhaps receive a higher price for this building.  He has great faith in Hong Kong. As did my ancestors. With obvious results.

Speaker: general li
Dialogue: ...Most eloquently put, Sir Elliot.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Thank you, General Li. Now I'll just sign this last document -

Speaker: general li
Dialogue: Sir Elliot! Red ink -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Of course! How foolish. More bad luck. I'll just borrow yours -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: An old Chinese toast to our friends...

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Confusion to the enemy. In 48 hours, that building - and all of Hong Kong around it - will cease to exist.

Speaker: crewman 1
Dialogue: Sounding: Bottom is thirty fathoms.

Speaker: crewman 2
Dialogue: Nothing. Negative bounce.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We should be right over it.

Speaker: operator 2
Dialogue: Wait - I'm getting something.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where? What is it?

Speaker: operator 2
Dialogue: Not sure yet -

Speaker: operator 2
Dialogue: The Shinjuku. Japanese troop carrier. World War II.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Let's make another pass.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Get rid of them.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Morning, morning all. What have we got?

Speaker: executive secretary
Dialogue: The Canadian Prime Minister wants to set a lunch -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Pencil it in for the next trip -

Speaker: executive secretary
Dialogue: The American presidential candidate called to complain about that sex story -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Send him a $10,000 campaign contribution, and explain I have no control over what my journalists write -

Speaker: executive secretary
Dialogue: Your bankers want an answer about the Brazilian TV stations

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: No -

Speaker: executive secretary
Dialogue: The Queen invited you to dinner -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Yes -

Speaker: executive secretary
Dialogue: And the 9:30 news meeting is waiting.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Excellent.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Morning, all my golden retrievers. What kind of havoc shall we create in the world today?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Better.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Boring -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Dog bites man.  Man bites dog is a news story. Riots at the World Cup soccer finals is a social announcement. Next?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Is that so?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I'm shocked!! Issue the usual vehement protest: Freedom of the press, people's right to know... Lather it up with a lot of righteous indignation.  Next?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Still nothing?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Wade, what the hell are you doing here?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I am not here, ol' buddy. The CIA has absolutely no knowledge of the missing ship, the missing gold, where it was going, or when it left Hong Kong.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: That's reassuring.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Hey - the world is my office.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Let's take a look at the body.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Smells like... Coffee plants.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Colorful... Shark attack?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I don't think so. The veins are cauterized - as if they were sealed by heat...  Who found the body?

Speaker: police officer
Dialogue: Dato. Local fisherman. Says it came in with the tide early this morning.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Ask him if it could have washed in from the west side of the Strait.

Speaker: policeman
Dialogue: No. He says it's not possible. The current could have only brought the body in from the east.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You have a boat?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I don't know if you'd call it a boat...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Something with an engine? Not oars?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Step into my office.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: What do you want with the Harbor Master?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Tide and current charts. Work backward from the body - find where the ship sank.  Where did you get the boat?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Seized it from a guy smuggling computer chips out of Bangkok.  Should have seen his rose garden: Blooms the size of hand grenades.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Over there.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I think I've just seen my next future ex-wife.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Not if you kill us first - unless that's how you plan to leave Muffy.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: By the way, Jimbo - whatever happened to that girl - in Cuba - ?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Natalya?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yeah. Russian Minister of Transportation.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: She married a hockey player.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I envy your 'undercover' assignments.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We work in the dark. We do what we can.

Speaker: harbor master
Dialogue: Wind, tide, currents... You're the second person today asked for a full set of charts.  If you'd just sign here -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Thanks.  By the way - was there anything strange the night before last? Odd weather, lost boats - ??

Speaker: harbor master
Dialogue: No... Unless you're talking about the bus problem.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...Bus problem?

Speaker: harbor master
Dialogue: Captain Cheong's ferry was late. He runs the line across the Strait between here and Sumatra. The lumber mill workers coming back for the weekend missed the last bus. Slept on the docks. Hundreds of them.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I have to get these to London. Do you know this Captain Cheong?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Spends his nights at the Kuala Lumpur yacht club.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Can you arrange a meeting?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Hell. The CIA built that club.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Okay gentlemen. The name of the game is 7-card Cambodian stud. Everything is wild!

Speaker: captain cheong
Dialogue: In the Strait of Malacca, when a boat is even five minutes late, one begins to worry, Mr. Bond.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I know. Pirates from Sumatra want the cargo; smugglers from Thailand and Burma want the ships.

Speaker: captain cheong
Dialogue: Sometimes kill the crew; other times -  Torture them.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: captain cheong
Dialogue: The Kuala Lumpur ferry was 35 miles off-course that night. Captain blamed the auto-pilot; I suspected he was drunk - until the Sumatra ferry captain had same problem.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Did you test the auto-pilots? The satellite positioning receiver?

Speaker: captain cheong
Dialogue: Next morning. Both boats. Nothing wrong.  My 90 year old grandfather thinks 'Ghost in the computer - Silicon Dragon.'

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I appreciate your time -

Speaker: captain cheong
Dialogue: Maybe you should talk to Sidney Winch. Owns a marine salvage company. Nobody knows more about the Strait.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where can I find him?

Speaker: captain cheong
Dialogue: Him? He, is a she -  at the bar.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Bourbon. Neat.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I wonder if you handle your liquor more carefully than you handle your boat.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Sometimes, you just have to plunge into things. Be reckless.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: - And I bet you always leave turmoil in your wake.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Have we met?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: This afternoon. Our boats practically kissed in the harbor.  James Bond.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Sidney Winch.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Vodka martini, shaken not stirred.  And another for you?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No. But you can buy a drink for my friend, Taro.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Boyfriend?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Chaperone. I'm waiting for my dinner date.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Pity.  Bring him whatever he wants.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: So what brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mr. Bond?  Wait - don't tell me: Unhappy marriage? Running from some poor little girl with two kids and a Chanel pocketbook in - London?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Actually, I'm here on business. You might say it was a... Golden opportunity.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And exactly what business are you in, Mr. Bond?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Insurance. Lloyds of London.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: The Strait can be a very dangerous place, Mr. Bond. A few words scribbled on a piece of paper in London doesn't carry a lot of value out here. Including life insurance.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'll keep that in mind.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And I think Mr. Bond is ready to leave.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Nice to run into you again.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Let's not make it a habit.

Speaker: taro
Dialogue: I think you should go -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Not quite yet, Taro -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Uncle Elliot!!

Speaker: taro
Dialogue: I said you should -

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yo! Jimbo! I won five hundred -  What happened?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He tied one on.

Speaker: girl one
Dialogue: Good morning!

Speaker: girl two
Dialogue: Good morning.

Speaker: girl three
Dialogue: He's arrived.

Speaker: q's voice
Dialogue: You're late 007. I've been expecting you.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Q! How are you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'm sorry. It was a national emergency -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Do you have any idea of what any of that means? In English?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Do I have to dial '9' to get out?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: - Four wheel drive?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... 17 Beverage cup holders?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I must say, Q, you seem to be doing rather well in your retirement.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Slow down. We're close.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I dunno, Jimbo. It can't be out here. How could they get this far off course?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who knows? Fog, night...

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: They'd never sail this close to the shore.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Wait a minute -  I've got it. There! Off the port bow!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Cut the engines! It's about two- hundred fifty feet down.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Two-fifty's pretty deep for air. You should really be using mixed gases.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'll make a bounce dive. If I can keep my bottom time short, I'll be all right.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Keep your eye out for pirates.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I got you covered.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: That's reassuring.

Speaker: taro
Dialogue: Uzi beats knife.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...Interesting point.

Speaker: taro
Dialogue: Get him up. Take his belt.  Take the two of them to the Captain.

Speaker: taro
Dialogue: By the way. I almost forgot.  I owed you one.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Smell that Jimmy? Sea Kelp.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Hey - it could be worse. At least they speak English.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...Somehow, that's not reassuring.

Speaker: taro
Dialogue: Here they are, Captain.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Just give me one goad reason - Mister Bond, from Lloyds of London - why I shouldn't kill both of you, burn your boat, and use your bodies for shark bait.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: So you two know each other!?! Small world, ain't it? What happened? Commitment problems?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Who is he?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sidney Winch, meet -

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Jack Wade. Citibank. Commercial loan division. If you're ever lookin' for a sweet refinance on the boat -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: - Shut up!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...But she won't kill us.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: No. First, because I don't think it's in your nature. And second, because there's no gold down there.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: So charming! So suave!  Don't insult me. I'm not one of your 'little London girls' who falls for the lies.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: So it was commitment!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Every wharf-rat from here to Hong Kong knows what's on that boat and I'm claiming it. One-third of that gold is mine.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: That's fine, but - even a little London girl knows that one third of nothing is still nothing.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Was he carrying anything?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Search him.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Do I have to do everything around here?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I hope so.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I hope you'll be gentle.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Think about mom.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Unusual technique.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And what do you call this?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: - The family jewels?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: technician
Dialogue: ...I don't know. I'm not sure -

Speaker: crewman
Dialogue: Boss! We got company - comin' up off the starboard bow!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Bring them.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Attention sea barge: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Repeat: Lay down your weapons, and prepare to be boarded.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: If I were you -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: - You're not.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Just remember: They think there's ten billion dollars in gold down there.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Thank you.  "Now hear this: Drop dead."

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Gatling gun beats Uzi.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Who's in charge here?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I am. What do you want?

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: You have precisely one minute to pull up your anchor and be under way.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Forget it. No way. I got here first.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Who's Wade?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: That would be me -

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: And you're Bond?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes -

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Guard! Arrest these men! Escort them to the cutter!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Wait a minute -

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Get them out of here. If he says one word, shoot him.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Captain Morton.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: My name is Sidney Winch, and -

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Good for you, Miss Winch. You now have exactly 30 seconds to get this rust bucket out of here.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I know my rights. These are international waters. The British Navy abandoned that boat, and I'm claiming it. Under international law, I have the right to salvage what's on that wreck.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Fifteen seconds. Perhaps you should consider hiring an attorney.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I was an attorney!

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Hmmm. I suppose this is a step above that profession.  Ten seconds. Are you leaving?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: You leave me no alternative.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Cut her anchor.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You won't get away with this!

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Good-day, Miss Winch. I advise you to get some steam up - before you run aground.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You bastards! Believe me - you haven't heard the last of me!

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: - Nice trick with the arrest. Very convincing.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: It's no trick, Mr. Wade. I've got half a mind to throw both of you in the brig.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Don't you think you're overreacting?

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: Endangering the gold, attracting that lunatic woman, and then putting in a distress call for us to save your bloody hide.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: There's no gold down there.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: What are you talking about? We went through all this and the ship isn't even down there?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes, the ship is down there. But the gold is gone.

Speaker: captain morton
Dialogue: That's absurd! It took two squads of forty men fifteen days to load that gold.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I know what I saw -

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: I don't care what you think you saw. You're a damned amateur.  Just get off my ship. Go back to your trench-coats and your code names - and leave the job to professionals.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Aye-aye, Captain.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Where to now, Jimbo?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'm not certain... But I think there's someone I want to press for some answers in Kuala Lumpur.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Bond.

Speaker: harmsway's voice
Dialogue: Hello, Mister Bond.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Who is this?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Elliot Harmsway! I heard you were in K.L. and thought we might get together for a chat...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: How did you get this number?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Oh, please, Mr. Bond. We live in the information age! Information is currency - and with the right currency, you can have any piece of information.  Besides I own the phone company. What do you say? Twenty minutes?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'm on my way.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Let's find out exactly what he knows.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: James Bond to see Elliot Harmsway.

Speaker: pr woman
Dialogue: Yes. I'm to bring you right up. The valet will take your car -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'd prefer to park it myself.  Temperamental. Practically has a mind of its own.

Speaker: pr woman
Dialogue: Don't they all?

Speaker: pr woman
Dialogue: Right this way.

Speaker: pr woman
Dialogue: Mr. Harmsway is checking the afternoon editions. If you'll just follow me -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Mr. Bond! Nice to see you.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sir Elliot.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Come. Let's get out of the noise.  - I'll give you a tour of the building, then we'll talk.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: It's funny, Mr. Bond. Of all the things I own, nothing gives me as much enjoyment as my newspapers.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes... A man with ink in his veins, and blood on his hands.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: We print 31 newspapers here; another two-hundred-and-seventy at satellite plants around the world.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... And how many of those newspapers carried Paris Harmsway's obituary?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: All of them, Mister Bond...  After you?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Before I became involved with Paris, she was always involved with the most inappropriate' men...  Playboys. Thrill seekers. Middle aged Peter Pans who only brought out the worst in her.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I see.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I tried to save her. But she remained a manic depressive: Fits, inappropriate behavior... Delusions of grandeur.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I wonder if it runs in the family.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: The only difference between a psychopath and a genius, Mr. Bond, is the degree of success.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Still, I do miss her. I only wish she could have lived to see all this.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I can feel your pain.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: By the way - what is it that brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mister Bond?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sightseeing.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I call this the Rogue's gallery.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes. I can see: You've hung the rest of your relatives.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: It was a city of unlimited possibility.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: So why did you leave?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Because it's a dying city. Since the Chinese take-over, who knows what can happen tomorrow?  I turned it into this

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Welcome to the new world order, Mr. Bond.  2000 people working on 14 floors to feed 300 newspapers, 4 cable news networks, 87 magazines, and 29 different cable TV channels - in 35 languages.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And still not a thing to watch.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...Although it must be fun to have all those satellites.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: They're merely tools to disseminate information.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Or disinformation... If you wanted to, say, beam down a signal to send a ship off course? Maybe one degree a minute?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: You amuse me. ...And now perhaps I can amuse you.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Let's see... First we have this James Bond... I believe he's a field adjuster for Lloyd's of London...

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Then we have this James Bond.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Or perhaps you'd prefer this James Bond -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: You see, Mr. Bond, you and I are both men of action. But your era is passing. Words are the new weapons; satellites the new artillery. And make no mistake about it: In the right hands, they can be as deadly as your Walther PPK.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...Words to live by?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Your choice.  Look at the time! Come. There's someone I want you meet - about a story I'm thinking of publishing.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Hello, dear. I'm sorry I took so long -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: That's okay, Uncle Ell -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What is HE doing here?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I see you two have met.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Briefly.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...Aren't you, Mr. Bond?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: He's not going to tell the truth! He was diving for the gold!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: It seems - Mr. Bond - that Miss Winch has told me the most incredible story: A sunken British warship filled with gold; a British cutter firing on her; billions of dollars in bullion lying on the bottom of the Strait.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Obviously, the British government denies all of this -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: - I told you! He was there! -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: - But as I've explained to Sidney, without proof, there's just no story. Don't you agree Mr. Bond?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: But I have proof! You ran out of here so fast, I didn't get to show you.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...And what's that, my dear?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sidney, perhaps we should leave this to -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: He brought that up from the wreck.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...I see.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sidney, I wouldn't -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And what about this? Any idea what this is?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ... I believe it's a depleted uranium drill bit, my dear.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Why don't we just take these -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No. I want Sir Elliot to keep them.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...Well! I do believe this requires further investigation!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Thank you, Uncle Elliot.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: No matter what the British government says, I won't kill this story.  Miss Oxford will show both of you to the elevator... And one of my people will definitely be in touch sooner than later.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'm sure they will.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Good-bye, Mister Bond.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Good-bye, darling.

Speaker: executive secretary
Dialogue: Thank you both for coming in...

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Do you have a gun?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I left mine in the car.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: That's funny: you struck me as the kind of man who always carries protection.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Listen to me! I'm a British secret service agent. And we have about two minutes before Harmsway kills both of us.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Has anyone ever suggested that you're a paranoid psychotic?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Harmsway sank that ship and stole the gold. It's on the Sea Dolphin II.  We're the only ones who can tie him to the crime.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Elliot Harmsway is my Uncle!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Blood or Dutch?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: He was my father's best friend!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He's killed closer.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You are seriously deranged.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Maybe. But why are we going up instead of down?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sidney, come with me -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Not if my life depended on it.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Thank God! He's crazy!

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Does he have a gun?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Good -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: This is a mistake!

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Need a lift?

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Help me up.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... I'd try the stairs.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Attention all units! They're on the 71st floor!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Stamper! They're not to leave this building alive!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: This has got to be a mistake.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: The only mistake is that they didn't kill us in the elevator.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Wait here.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No. I'm going with you.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Where are they?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Roger! Over and -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Out.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: JAMES!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Okay. So it wasn't a mistake.  What do we do now? Offer them dinner?!?!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Come here. You shoot. I'll cook.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Aim that way.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Shoot back!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: One second -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... How did you get into marine salvage?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: My father left me the business.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: I used to be a divorce lawyer in New York City.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Not a lot of difference.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Either way, you're taking the goods from dead hulks.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Let's go -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Damn!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What the hell does that do?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Cleans dirt. Let's go.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: It's a trick! After him.  They're in the south stairwell!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Get more men up there!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Down?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Up.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Down?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Up.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ... And so much for that.  Nowhere to go.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Now what?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: That should buy us some time.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Help me move this.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I'll call for a battering ram -

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: No. Get the fire ax.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We'll go down close to the sky bridge. We may be able to swing over and use it for cover.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No way. I sail. I do not fly.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Sometimes, you just have to take the plunge.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: All I know is one thing: If we get out of here alive, that gold is mine.  I've earned it.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: One thing at a time.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What now? And don't give me some movie clich like 'trust me.'

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Trust me.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Let's go -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: We're going to bounce off that thing!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Hold on!

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: They're on the bridge. Seal off the 50th floor!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Get somebody up there!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What about the elevators?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We tried that already. Remember?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You know, this is as much your fault as it is mine.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sidney, we don't have time for this -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Sure! Just when I want to talk -  Not that I would have believed you -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Put your back to the railing. Sit up on it.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Are you listening to me?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Put your arms around my neck. Lock your legs around my waist.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: ... We have time for that?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sometimes you just have to -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Don't say it.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Is this - like - a normal day for you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: It's a lousy job, but -  The only reason I stay is for the health benefits.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: They're heading for the press room. Stop them!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: He was bad news.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Down there!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I think they'd rather know who stole their gold.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Now both of you: Stand up. And toss the gun out, Mr. Bond.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Uncle Elliot: How could you do this to me?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Oh, please, Sidney. There's a hundred billion dollars at stake.  Besides, I never really liked your father that much. He cheated at cards.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Are your guards really going to kill a helpless girl?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: My guards are from South Africa, Mr. Bond. This is their chance to get even with the formerly 'Great' Britain.  Now both of you. Put your hands on your heads, and step forward.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What did you do, Harmsway? Make some deal with the Chinese government for the gold?.. Was the radioactive uranium I found in Venice part of it?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Questions, questions, Mr. Bond... Which I'm afraid I've neither the time, nor the inclination to answer.  Take them out to the jungle and -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I forgot to mention: The job comes with a car.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Kill it! Shoot the damn thing -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Here. You shoot. I'll drive.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: ...You know, that's another reason you're probably not in a successful relationship.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Another reason??? Did I miss something???

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: And by the way: I am not a helpless girl.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Aim that way.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Ready? Now!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Seal the garage! Cut the power! He's got no headlamps!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: We're not going to make it!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: If it's radio controlled, it'll break the code.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: If not?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: We blast through.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: - Built to withstand a nuclear blast.  Are they alive?

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Yes. Shall we kill them?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: No. I have a better idea. In fact, Mr. Bond may have actually improved my original plan.  Bring them both to Hong Kong. And Make sure he has nothing else up his sleeve.

Speaker: chin
Dialogue: Totally secure. Without codes, you'd need a missile to blast through the front door; you normally can't even get this close  without a full security clearance.

Speaker: chin
Dialogue: Of course. You'd need -

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Let's go!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Get the machine in the water!

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: A generator blew. Nothing to worry about.  But I need one last shot of you. Why don't you stand by the alarm?

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Up the stairs!

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Put on your clothes.  Cuff him.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: I'm sorry to interrupt again. But we need one more picture for the story.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Sleep well?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Next time, I do the driving.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: The drill is in the water; approaching the intake tunnel.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Excellent.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I see you're in your natural element, Harmsway: A room filled with lethal power...  ...With a toxic core at its center.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Do come in Mr. Bond, Sidney... You're just in time for a nuclear meltdown!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You bastard -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Please, Sidney. I'd like to remember you fondly.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Approaching the first gate.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Start the grinders.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ...So that's what the weapons grade uranium was for.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Precisely, Mr. Bond. In a matter of minutes, the boring device will arrive at the core of the reactor...  And when the radioactive blades cut into the plutonium -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: - Instant melt-down.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Chernobyl will look like a campfire.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: We're through the first gate. Approaching the second -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Why, Harmsway? Wasn't stealing the gold enough?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Revenge is the best revenge.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Entering the main tunnel - ten minutes to target -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What could you possibly have to be vengeful for, Harmsway? Still trying to prove yourself to daddy?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Hong Kong, Mr. Bond!

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: You have to leave -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: The gold is merely reparations - payment from the spineless British government who wouldn't listen.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... I think Uncle Elliot is having his own melt-down.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Approaching the third gate -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Smash through it!  Here. This just in. Newsflash. Read all about it.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Hong Kong destroyed by nuclear meltdown... British agent found in reactor suspected of sabotage; Harmsway calls for British government to resign.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...As the advertising says: Tomorrow never lies.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: What about the gold?

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: You must go. Now. Otherwise the boat won't be out of range -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Thirty seconds.  And just by coincidence:

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: ...Gold mine opens in Vietnam.  Let's go. Put them in the airlock.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You'll never get away with it, Harmsway. Too many people know.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Who, Mr. Bond? The kooks - the crazies - the conspiracy theorists? The Oliver Stones of the world?  They're my bellboys. They carry my luggage.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Now. Get them in the airlock.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: One problem, Harmsway: The girl. And the handcuffs. They'll give it away.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: No. I want to stay with him.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: How sweet.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: My timing always was lousy.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I'd rather die alone.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Take the girl. Leave the handcuffs. We'll drown her at sea.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Enjoy the rest of your life.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: I'll meet you on the boat, south of Lantau Island.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Take the men. I can finish alone.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: You stay here.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: We'll cut through the last gate, then set it on auto-pilot.

Speaker: yung
Dialogue: Check it out. Be careful.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Any news?

Speaker: the captain
Dialogue: The call just went out on the Hong Kong police radio: Fire at the power plant.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Alert the media!

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: What do you want me to do with her?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: - Can't we make a deal? I won't say anything -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Put her in the storage room.

Speaker: cameraman
Dialogue: Don't get any ideas.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: There it is.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: It's him. They both made it.

Speaker: the captain
Dialogue: I'll tell Sir Elliot.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: captain's voice
Dialogue: He's approaching from the north, sir.

Speaker: crewman
Dialogue: Fantastic. Invite the crew on deck to celebrate, and I'll be up in a few minutes.

Speaker: crewman
Dialogue: He seems to be coming in awfully fast.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: Get the guns! It's not him! It's Bond!!!

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: What the hell is going on?

Speaker: the captain
Dialogue: I don't know sir -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: What the hell is going on?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Kill him! Finish it!

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: You're mine now.

Speaker: stamper
Dialogue: I'm going to do this slowly -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Stamper! Report in!

Speaker: harmsway's voice
Dialogue: Report to the bridge!

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I never believe what I read in the newspapers.

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: Pity you'll miss your obituary.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where is she, Harmsway?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: You want to kill me, Bond? Go ahead.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where is she Harmsway? -

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: What is it, Bond? You haven't the guts?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: You spineless paper tiger -

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Where is she, Harmsway?!? Or did you kill her like Paris?

Speaker: harmsway
Dialogue: We all go down together!!!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: What do you mean, you'd rather die alone?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: I didn't say when I want to die -

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Before we go any further here, Mr. Bond, from Lloyds of London, I just want to get two things straight.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: ... Yes?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: First, that boat is in international waters. I'm claiming it for salvage. One-third of that gold is mine.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And number two?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: If you think we're going to have some kind of 'life affirming' romance here just because we cheated death, let me be clear:  We're going to have it where I want, and when I want.

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: And when might that be?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Now.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Life is not fair.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Excuse me, Major Boothroyd - the message went to London.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Tell me, Q-ster. You do ever do any gardening?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: James... Is this really what a typical day is like for you?

Speaker: bond
Dialogue: Yes...  But some days... Are longer than others.
